Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will play their third game of the T20 World Cup 2024 against the United States of America on June 14, 2024, in Florida. Ireland is struggling to qualify for the Super 8 stages after losing their first two matches. They need to beat the USA, along with an Indian win over Canada and a win against Pakistan, to advance. The article highlights Ireland's opening pair struggles, with Andrew Balbirnie and Paul Stirling both facing form issues. The middle order includes Lorcan Tucker and Harry Tector, who are expected to play crucial roles. The all-rounders, bowlers, and the rest of the XI are also mentioned with their potential impacts on the match.
Others: The article provides the likely Ireland XI for the match against the USA, including players like Andrew Balbirnie, Paul Stirling, Lorcan Tucker, and Joshua Little, among others.
